p: The emerging field of climate law is inter-disciplinary and extends to often unsatisfactorily defined concepts such as a ‘carbon net zero economy’ and ‘sustainable finance’. Since 1992, the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP) Finance Initiative (FI) has partnered with the global financial services sector including banks, insurers, and investors in a commitment that “we … recognize that economic development needs to be compatible with human welfare and a healthy environment” [41]. Yet whilst older environmental regulations have provided legal avenues to petition for public health justice, they have been hindered by the economic ideology that profit trumps health, ecology, and ecosystems [42].
